commit_message:
devstack: install Gnocchi using pip

change to continue testing 3.1.x
- use file instead of redis since it don't exist
- steal uwsgi setup from devstack master

and Migrate to Zuul v3

Migrate all functional jobs and gate to zuul v3.
We will have to migrate all other legacy jobs too later.
This patch do step 1 in the docs: Move Legacy Jobs to Projects.

diff:
- do not port elasticsearch check
- remove jobs unrelated to branch
- cleanup telemetry-integration gate
Change-Id: Idf49c523c1d0632e8d095e4804817e7b5e772902
(cherry picked from commit cc7950c86fed77e3395504530ac5dd116b4b4e5b)

Change-Id: I55193f2e39a41fe2bb378b4380f2ae52c5685c8d
(cherry picked from commit 898117902437cded9d8150ffa42869a02e3765d8)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/74/512374/20 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: elif [ "$CEILOMETER_BACKEND" = "gnocchi" ]; then enable_service gnocchi-api gnocchi-metricd# TODO(sileht): when Gnocchi 4.0 is out use the tarball instead GNOCCHI_GIT_PATH=${GNOCCHI_GIT_PATH:-git+https://github.com/gnocchixyz/gnocchi#egg=gnocchi}GNOCCHI_CONF_DIR=${GNOCCHI_CONF_DIR:-/etc/gnocchi} GNOCCHI_CONF=${GNOCCHI_CONF:-${GNOCCHI_CONF_DIR}/gnocchi.conf} GNOCCHI_COORDINATOR_URL=${CEILOMETER_COORDINATOR_URL:-redis://localhost:6379} GNOCCHI_METRICD_PROCESSING_DELAY=${GNOCCHI_METRICD_PROCESSING_DELAY:-5} GNOCCHI_AUTH_CACHE_DIR=${GNOCCHI_AUTH_CACHE_DIR:-/var/cache/gnocchi} GNOCCHI_UWSGI_FILE=${GNOCCHI_UWSGI_FILE:-${GNOCCHI_CONF_DIR}/uwsgi.ini} GNOCCHI_SERVICE_PROTOCOL=http GNOCCHI_SERVICE_HOST=${GNOCCHI_SERVICE_HOST:-${SERVICE_HOST}} GNOCCHI_WSGI_DIR=${GNOCCHI_WSGI_DIR:-/var/www/gnocchi}
deleted_lines: if [ "$CEILOMETER_BACKEND" == 'gnocchi' ]; then local seen_gnocchi=False for plugin in ${plugins//,/ }; do if [ "$plugin" == 'gnocchi' ]; then seen_gnocchi=True elif [ "$plugin" == 'ceilometer' ] && [ "$seen_gnocchi" == 'False' ]; then die $LINENO "gnocchi must be enabled before ceilometer!" fi done fi

commit_message:
Zuul-v3: add required projects for neutron-lib periodic jobs

Before moving away from the legacy/deprecated way of doing things,
bring sanity back to periodic runs for neutron-lib related projects.

This is step 1 of 2 (#2 to fix Grafana).

Depends-on: Ic05f2f9484af05b2b2d0fe143e0bb87700e116fd
Change-Id: I2950d41887b9820e9e4785650c3743792e5c73c3

commit_message:
It's Zuul

Update jenkins/scripts/common.sh which is used by proposal jobs:
Do not check for changes by Jenkins, check for changes by Zuul instead.

Change-Id: Iff412ce8c75bbdfd82281160e4dd22190d220fb7

commit_message:
Add more settings to glance-api

Settings added:
- limit_param_default, The default number of results to return
  for a request.
- api_limit_max, Maximum number of results that could be returned
  by a request.

Change-Id: I5362e2b15531df1d2160b67ce2b572c64b1b0989
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit ebbac230d19ca50658fbd8d05eae08fa6186e1b6)

commit_message:
Swap the order of libcloud and shade in Python

Let's lead with our own lib which is OpenStack specific, then go with
libcloud which is multi-cloud.

commit_message:
Split SDK list into openstack and multi-cloud

OpenStack specific SDKs and multi-cloud abstraction SDKs are different
beasts. Let's group them for clarity.

Also, reindented because tracking div opens and closes was confusing
since some of the divs didn't indent.

Change-Id: I20172bcd19f52d627109838e48e6a6d0727b6604

commit_message:
Add external deployment tasks executed on undercloud

Services can define external_deploy_tasks, which are meant to be
executed on the undercloud node. They are step-based as the other
Ansible tasks we have, and they get executed during each deployment
step before the puppet and docker tasks.

These tasks can be used to perform complex actions from the
undercloud, such as executing nested installers like kubespray or
ceph-ansible. This should allow deploying overcloud with a single
Ansible playbook, and without creating Ansible->Mistral->Ansible loop.

Implements: blueprint ansible-config-download
Change-Id: I3dcafb96f5cea5fdcebe2b2012b61a38b0568834
Depends-On: I8491540edf78711f3229eabeda22a17cd55e99c8

commit_message:
Allow processing external_deploy_steps_tasks

Process external_deploy_steps_tasks as a part of config download
mechanism, which will allow services to export Ansible tasks to be
executed on undercloud directly, with full undercloud and overcloud
inventory available.

These tasks can be used to perform complex actions from the
undercloud, such as executing nested installers like kubespray or
ceph-ansible. This should allow deploying overcloud with a single
Ansible playbook, and without creating Ansible->Mistral->Ansible loop.

Implements: blueprint ansible-config-download
Change-Id: I8491540edf78711f3229eabeda22a17cd55e99c8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/81/510781/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _write_undercloud_tasks(self, directory, undercloud_tasks): for tasks_name, tasks in six.iteritems(undercloud_tasks): # Remove duplicates. # NOTE: We can't use set() as dicts aren't hashable. The # implemented approach is O(n^2). If we have too many # undercloud tasks and this becomes a performance issue, # we might want to implement a hashable internal # representation. Or add YAQL as a dependency and use it, # as YAQL uses custom internal dict representations which # are hashable. unique_tasks = [] for task in tasks: if not task in unique_tasks: unique_tasks.append(task) file_path = os.path.join(directory, '%s.yaml' % tasks_name) with self._open_file(file_path) as tasks_file: yaml.safe_dump(unique_tasks, tasks_file, default_flow_style=False) undercloud_tasks = {} elif config in constants.UNDERCLOUD_TASKS: undercloud_tasks \ .setdefault(config, []).extend(role[config]) self._write_undercloud_tasks(tmp_path, undercloud_tasks)

subject: Config download support for all deployments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-28 14:38:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/df4e9924a47bb58d6f91e2477c9e83471914731e', 'message': 'Config download support for all deployments

Presently, "openstack overcloud config download" only supports the
OS::HeatSoftwareDeploymentGroup (plural) resources from
deploy-steps.yaml.

This patch adds support to the command to also pull the deployment
resources for each individual server from the OS::Heat::Value resources
called "TripleODeployment", as well as other SoftwareDeploymentGroup
resources not from deploy-steps.j2. See the Depends-On
tripleo-heat-templates patch for how these resources are mapped.

These deployments are applied by additional plays in the generated
playbooks. Instead of having to reimplement each deployment in a native
group:ansible, the ansible tasks just trigger the deployments by calling
55-heat-config remotely with the rendered json deployment data for
whatever deployment is being applied.

This method saves us from having to migrate all these resources to
native ansible (and requring all end users to do so).

Also included is a helper script called tripleo-config-download to run
the config download outside of Mistral.

Change-Id: I7d7f6b831b8566390d8f747fb6f45e879b0392ba
Depends-On: Ic2af634403b1ab2924c383035f770453f39a2cd5
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-09-28 21:01:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/cda437fb0b9f3efb6a9eb3c2c8e1d42e89e5e658', 'message': 'Config download support for all deployments

Presently, "openstack overcloud config download" only supports the
OS::HeatSoftwareDeploymentGroup (plural) resources from
deploy-steps.yaml.

This patch adds support to the command to also pull the deployment
resources for each individual server from the OS::Heat::Value resources
called "TripleODeployment", as well as other SoftwareDeploymentGroup
resources not from deploy-steps.j2. See the Depends-On
tripleo-heat-templates patch for how these resources are mapped.

These deployments are applied by additional plays in the generated
playbooks. Instead of having to reimplement each deployment in a native
group:ansible, the ansible tasks just trigger the deployments by calling
55-heat-config remotely with the rendered json deployment data for
whatever deployment is being applied.

This method saves us from having to migrate all these resources to
native ansible (and requring all end users to do so).

Also included is a helper script called tripleo-config-download to run
the config download outside of Mistral.

Change-Id: I7d7f6b831b8566390d8f747fb6f45e879b0392ba
Depends-On: Ic2af634403b1ab2924c383035f770453f39a2cd5

commit_message:
Config download support for all deployments

Presently, "openstack overcloud config download" only supports the
OS::HeatSoftwareDeploymentGroup (plural) resources from
deploy-steps.yaml.

This patch adds support to the command to also pull the deployment
resources for each individual server from the OS::Heat::Value resources
called "TripleODeployment", as well as other SoftwareDeploymentGroup
resources not from deploy-steps.j2. See the Depends-On
tripleo-heat-templates patch for how these resources are mapped.

These deployments are applied by additional plays in the generated
playbooks. Instead of having to reimplement each deployment in a native
group:ansible, the ansible tasks just trigger the deployments by calling
55-heat-config remotely with the rendered json deployment data for
whatever deployment is being applied.

This method saves us from having to migrate all these resources to
native ansible (and requring all end users to do so).

Also included is a helper script called tripleo-config-download to run
the config download outside of Mistral.

implements: blueprint ansible-config-download
Change-Id: I7d7f6b831b8566390d8f747fb6f45e879b0392ba
Depends-On: Ic2af634403b1ab2924c383035f770453f39a2cd5

commit_message:
Add /etc/environment to flannel/etcd/kubelet

Everything is containerized in rkt. If behind proxy, flannel, etcd
and kubelet will failed to rkt fetch images and cluster creation
will failed.

Closes-Bug: #1689618
Change-Id: Ia12deeb659483980d2a20e4cba5d449167b600d0

commit_message:
Update keystone auth_uri and auth_url

Update keystone auth_uri and auth_url in zun.conf to connect with keystone
using /identity/v3 and /identity_admin/v3.

Closes-Bug: #1692576
Change-Id: Ie107e6ef9d3ebfee77b4782842e1ed966738c6cd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun refs/changes/20/512920/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset $ZUN_CONF keystone_auth auth_url $KEYSTONE_AUTH_URI_V3 iniset $ZUN_CONF keystone_authtoken auth_uri $KEYSTONE_SERVICE_URI_V3 iniset $ZUN_CONF keystone_authtoken auth_url $KEYSTONE_AUTH_URI_V3
deleted_lines: iniset $ZUN_CONF keystone_auth auth_url $KEYSTONE_SERVICE_URI/v3 iniset $ZUN_CONF keystone_authtoken auth_uri \ ${KEYSTONE_SERVICE_PROTOCOL}://${KEYSTONE_SERVICE_HOST}:${KEYSTONE_SERVICE_PORT}/v3

Response Codes -------------- .. rest_status_code:: success status.yaml - 200 .. rest_status_code:: error status.yaml - 401 - 403 - 404 - 409 Request ------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - container_ident: container_ident - path: path Response -------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - data: data - stat: stat Put archive to a container ========================== .. rest_method:: POST /v1/containers/{container_ident}/put_archive?path={path} Put archive to a container. Store the Evaluator action tracker cache to db

Change-Id: Ic94ebbd5a856a293d4f5b99f653a2fe9776185ee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/vitrage refs/changes/34/513334/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_db.options import database_optsfrom vitrage import storage from vitrage.storage.sqlalchemy import models cls.conf.register_opts(database_opts, group='database') cls.conf.set_override('connection', 'sqlite:///:memory:', group='database') cls._db = storage.get_connection_from_config(cls.conf) engine = cls._db._engine_facade.get_engine() models.Base.metadata.create_all(engine)

commit_message:
Allow to configure max-age for HSTS(HTTP Strict Transport Security)

HSTS is helpful to bring more protection to users, but on the other
hand, it locks down users to use HTTPS only until max-age expires. To
enable HSTS, admins must enable enforce-ssl option and set non-zero
value to hsts-max-age-seconds explicitly.

Content Security Policy (CSP) is not enabled this time. Horizon upstream
may need some work: https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1618024

Change-Id: I7fd774ba9a1c292d51625d6d36a086b2a531ae75
Partial-Bug: #1713202
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-openstack-dashboard refs/changes/98/511898/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: hsts-max-age-seconds: type: int default: 0 description: | "max-age" parameter for HSTS(HTTP Strict Transport Security) header. Use with causion since once you set this option, browsers will remember it so they can only use HTTPS (HTTP connection won't be allowed) until max-age expires. . A recommemded minimum value is six months (15768000). For more details on HSTS, refer: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/Security/HTTP_strict_transport_security . For this option to have an effect, SSL must be configured and enforce-ssl option must be true.

commit_message:
Fix post gate hook to accommodate for new os-testr

New os-testr uses stestr under the hood, which creates .stestr but not
.testrepository directory in the current dir. Other than that, it
doesn't seem like there is any difference in the format or names of
files generated in the directory.

Closes-bug: #1716746
Change-Id: Id8e7b7c678990d0b8d3f24f349800a8765206fa0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/81/513581/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ".tox/$venv/bin/subunit-1to2" < .stestr/0 > ./stestr.subunit $SCRIPTS_DIR/subunit2html ./stestr.subunit testr_results.html gzip -9 ./stestr.subunit

subject: stop updating rtfd for whereto
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-11 19:22:15.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/91366e103979b38e6c3659a024cb8eebc496ff2b', 'message': 'stop updating rtfd for whereto

After we have whereto docs publishing to docs.openstack.org we can
stop publishing them on rtfd.org.

Change-Id: I757d7cdc3d67ef3ae914d4f0c72176860fe33c12
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
stop updating rtfd for whereto

After we have whereto docs publishing to docs.openstack.org we can
stop publishing them on rtfd.org.

Change-Id: I757d7cdc3d67ef3ae914d4f0c72176860fe33c12
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/24/511324/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: [WIP] disk-usage refactoring
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-15 14:14:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/d904d5eaaa283c1aa0db50ab143fc9b1b3826733', 'message': '[WIP] disk-usage refactoring

The current implementation of disk usage computation was done
with exactly one partition in mind.  The computed result does
not make much sense in an environment of various level of block
devices with possible many mount points.

Currently the usage is computed at the wrong place: after the
computation some packages are installed like grub and all the
dependencies.

This patch adds a dib-disk-usage tool which scan and computes
the image just before the umount - also based on the file
systems that are created in the image.

Currently it only logs the information.  Later patches can pick
up the results and automatically adapt partition or LVM sizes.

The scan and computation takes less than 0.2 sec for a typical
minimal image.

ToDo:
* More / better comments in python tool
* test cases

Change-Id: I493d6934b95d5f9e3a2a7cbf94b18bfa00df265c
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-10-21 14:27:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/2d38dc2a0db143c00fbbc449d4e3f8a4ec806071', 'message': '[WIP] disk-usage refactoring

The current implementation of disk usage computation was done
with exactly one partition in mind.  The computed result does
not make much sense in an environment of various level of block
devices with possible many mount points.

Currently the usage is computed at the wrong place: after the
computation some packages are installed like grub and all the
dependencies.

This patch adds a dib-disk-usage tool which scan and computes
the image just before the umount - also based on the file
systems that are created in the image.

Currently it only logs the information.  Later patches can pick
up the results and automatically adapt partition or LVM sizes.

The scan and computation takes less than 0.2 sec for a typical
minimal image.

ToDo:
* More / better comments in python tool
* test cases

Change-Id: I493d6934b95d5f9e3a2a7cbf94b18bfa00df265c
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>

commit_message:
[WIP] disk-usage refactoring

The current implementation of disk usage computation was done
with exactly one partition in mind.  The computed result does
not make much sense in an environment of various level of block
devices with possible many mount points.

Currently the usage is computed at the wrong place: after the
computation some packages are installed like grub and all the
dependencies.

This patch adds a dib-disk-usage tool which scan and computes
the image just before the umount - also based on the file
systems that are created in the image.

Currently it only logs the information.  Later patches can pick
up the results and automatically adapt partition or LVM sizes.

The scan and computation takes less than 0.2 sec for a typical
minimal image.

ToDo:
* More / better comments in python tool
* test cases

Change-Id: I493d6934b95d5f9e3a2a7cbf94b18bfa00df265c
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/85/512085/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python # # Copyright 2017 Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net> # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import argparse import logging import os from diskimage_builder import logging_config logger = logging.getLogger(__name__) def parse_args(): parser = argparse.ArgumentParser( description='Compute disk usage based on mount points.') parser.add_argument( '--mount-points', required=True, help='List of mount points separated by "|"') parser.add_argument( '--base-path', required=True, help='Base path of the mounted directories') parser.add_argument( '--report-min-size', type=int, default=10 * 1024 * 1024, # 10MiB size help='Report files which bigger sizes - default 10MiB') parser.add_argument( '--report-min-blocks', type=int, default=10 * 1024 * 1024 / 512, # 10MiB disk usage help='Report files that use more disk space - default 10MiB in blocks') args = parser.parse_args() return args.base_path, args.mount_points.split("|"), \ args.report_min_size, args.report_min_blocks class FileSystemSizeStats(object): """Object holding statistics information like: size of files in bytes and blocks and number of directories. """ def __init__(self): # Number of files self.__file_count = 0 # Sum of all file sizes self.__file_size_in_bytes = 0 # As of stat() the unit is 512 bytes self.__file_size_in_blocks = 0 # Number of directories self.__dir_count = 0 def __repr__(self): return "File count [%d] dir count [%d] file size [%d]" \ % (self.__file_count, self.__dir_count, self.__file_size) def inc_counts(self, dir_count, file_count): self.__dir_count += dir_count self.__file_count += file_count def inc_file_size(self, byte_cnt, block_cnt): self.__file_size_in_bytes += byte_cnt self.__file_size_in_blocks += block_cnt def get_dir_cnt(self): return self.__dir_count def get_file_cnt(self): return self.__file_count def get_file_size_in_bytes(self): return self.__file_size_in_bytes def get_file_size_in_blocks(self): return self.__file_size_in_blocks class DiskUsage(object): def __init__(self, base_dir, mount_points, report_min_size, report_min_blocks): self.__base_dir = base_dir # Need the reverse sorted mount points here: # First match is the directory the subdirs will add the sizes. self.__mount_points = [] for mp in reversed(sorted(mount_points)): assert mp[0] == '/' self.__mount_points.append(mp[1:]) self.__report_min_size = report_min_size self.__report_min_blocks = report_min_blocks self.__mount_points_stats = {} for smp in self.__mount_points: self.__mount_points_stats[smp] = FileSystemSizeStats() self.__large_files = [] self.__fs_stats = {} def __find_mount_point(self, dir_name): for mp in self.__mount_points: if dir_name.startswith(mp): return mp print("ASSERT in find mount point [%s] in [%s]" % (dir_name, self.__mount_points)) assert False def __update_stats(self, root, dirs, files): # Find the first entry in mount points mp = self.__find_mount_point(root) size_stats = self.__mount_points_stats[mp] size_stats.inc_counts(len(dirs), len(files)) for lfile in files: try: full_path = os.path.join(root, lfile) st = os.lstat(full_path) size_stats.inc_file_size(st.st_size, st.st_blocks) if st.st_size > self.__report_min_size \ or st.st_blocks > self.__report_min_blocks: self.__large_files.append( (full_path, st.st_size, st.st_blocks)) except OSError: # Silently ignore OSErrors pass def scan(self): os.chdir(self.__base_dir) for root, dirs, files in os.walk("."): # Cut off './' from the beginning of the root directory while root.startswith('./'): root = root[2:] self.__update_stats(root, dirs, files) # Get the statfvs info for mp in self.__mount_points: stat_mp = mp if mp != "" else "." statvfs = os.statvfs(stat_mp) self.__fs_stats[mp] = (statvfs.f_frsize * statvfs.f_blocks, statvfs.f_frsize * statvfs.f_bfree, statvfs.f_frsize * statvfs.f_bavail, statvfs.f_files, statvfs.f_ffree, statvfs.f_favail) def get_mount_point_stats(self): return self.__mount_points_stats def get_large_files(self): return self.__large_files def get_fs_stats(self): return self.__fs_stats def main(): logging_config.setup() base_path, mount_points, report_min_size, report_min_blocks = parse_args() logging.info("Called dib-disk-usage with") logging.info(" base path [%s]", base_path) logging.info(" mount points [%s]", mount_points) logging.info(" report min size [%d]", report_min_size) logging.info(" report min blocks [%d]", report_min_blocks) du = DiskUsage(base_path, mount_points, report_min_size, report_min_blocks) du.scan() large_files = du.get_large_files() logging.info("Large files:") logging.info("[size on disk] [size in bytes] [name]") for name, size, blocks in reversed( sorted(large_files, key=lambda x: x[2])): logging.info("%14d %15d /%s", blocks * 512, size, name) logging.info("Disk usage result:") logging.info("[#dirs] [#files] [size on disk] [size in bytes] [name]") for name, mps in du.get_mount_point_stats().items(): logging.info("%7d %8d %14d %15d /%s", mps.get_dir_cnt(), mps.get_file_cnt(), mps.get_file_size_in_blocks() * 512, mps.get_file_size_in_bytes(), name) logging.info("File System Stats:") logging.info(" [size] [free] [avail]" "[inodes] [ifree] [iavail] [name]") for name, fsstats in du.get_fs_stats().items(): logging.info("%15d %15d %15d %12d %12d %12d /%s", fsstats[0], fsstats[1], fsstats[2], fsstats[3], fsstats[4], fsstats[5], name)

subject: use addr pairs api def from lib
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-21 14:39:51.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/neutron/db/models/l2.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow/commit/b401f761b22f8b814d7bc7d7a6741ba3deb2531a', 'message': "use addr pairs api def from lib

The allowed address pairs extension's API definition was rehomed into
neutron-lib with I7958a2d6f470f088ca2cb8ad638c075788f22851 and will be
consumed in neutron with I46cfeee9711973ec15881c8dc2bd0bf763bc2226

This patch switches the code over to use lib's version rather than
neutrons.

Change-Id: I40ab2abfe625c98b5506cc849ab489f68b375a06
"}]
commit_message:
use addr pairs api def from lib

The allowed address pairs extension's API definition was rehomed into
neutron-lib with I7958a2d6f470f088ca2cb8ad638c075788f22851 and will be
consumed in neutron with I46cfeee9711973ec15881c8dc2bd0bf763bc2226

This patch switches the code over to use lib's version rather than
neutrons.

Change-Id: I40ab2abfe625c98b5506cc849ab489f68b375a06
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/37/513937/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron_lib.api.definitions import allowedaddresspairs as addr_apidef port.get(addr_apidef.ADDRESS_PAIRS, [])),
deleted_lines: from neutron.extensions import allowedaddresspairs as addr_pair port.get(addr_pair.ADDRESS_PAIRS, [])),

subject: Add memcache backend
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-12 12:09:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-keystone/commit/09667c74b61e7f148bd7c29a7d9f6c5be8f03936', 'message': 'Add memcache backend

Install and configure memcached on the keystone units and configure
keystone to use the cache. This should speed up token access for

commit_message:
Add memcache backend

Install and configure memcached on the keystone units and configure
keystone to use the cache. This should speed up token access for
existing tokens.

Change-Id: I26af0a97660e5bbe293a32e6b9e3d209338f905a
Closes-Bug: #1722541

Error logs in api_nb were missing information

Instead of the actual object id, a non-existing object with the name id was
sent to the log.

Requirements propose_updates runs master only

frozen. Fix this for v3 set up.

subject: Add security headers to web accessable services.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-25 16:17:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone/commit/ab24d1ccd7ea6e2e02020f164a9560a9d7668bd0', 'message': 'Add security headers to web accessable services.

Adds the following headers as static:

    X-Content-Type-Options "nosniff"
    X-XSS-Protection "1; mode=block"
    append Content-Security-Policy "default-src 'self' https: wss:;"

nosniff prevents non-executable mime times from becoming executable.
The X-XSS-Protection header will prevent the loading of a page if the
browser detects an xss attack.  The Content-Security-Policy declares
what dynamic resources are allowed to load.

Adds the following header as user-setable via the
keystone_x_frame_options variable.

    X-Frame-Options "DENY"

By default the X-Frame-Options header denies embedding in an iframe.

commit_message:
Add security headers to web accessable services.

Adds the following headers as static:

    X-Content-Type-Options "nosniff"
    X-XSS-Protection "1; mode=block"
    append Content-Security-Policy "default-src 'self' https: wss:;"

nosniff prevents non-executable mime times from becoming executable.
The X-XSS-Protection header will prevent the loading of a page if the
browser detects an xss attack.  The Content-Security-Policy declares
what dynamic resources are allowed to load.

Adds the following header as user-setable via the
keystone_x_frame_options variable.

    X-Frame-Options "DENY"

By default the X-Frame-Options header denies embedding in an iframe.

Change-Id: Iadd3e93bdb7e9d41ae1d027196367448dbce19f1
Partial-Bug: 1717321

commit_message:
placement: the common method to filter resource providers by traits

This patch adds a common method to return a set of resource provider
IDs which has required traits.

Co-Authored-By: leizhang <lei.a.zhang@intel.com>

added_lines: def test_get_providers_ids_with_required_traits(self): rp_obj._ensure_rc_cache(self.ctx) # Create the three providers cn1_uuid = uuidsentinel.cn1 cn1 = objects.ResourceProvider( self.ctx, name='cn1', uuid=cn1_uuid, ) cn1.create() cn2_uuid = uuidsentinel.cn2 cn2 = objects.ResourceProvider( self.ctx, name='cn2', uuid=cn2_uuid, ) cn2.create() cn3_uuid = uuidsentinel.cn3 cn3 = objects.ResourceProvider( self.ctx, name='cn3', uuid=cn3_uuid, ) cn3.create() t_a = objects.Trait( self.ctx, name='CUSTOM_TRAIT_A' ) t_a.create() t_b = objects.Trait( self.ctx, name='CUSTOM_TRAIT_B' ) t_b.create() cn2.set_traits(objects.TraitList(objects=[t_a])) cn3.set_traits(objects.TraitList(objects=[t_a, t_b])) rp_ids = rp_obj._get_provider_ids_with_required_traits( self.ctx, ['CUSTOM_TRAIT_A']) self.assertEqual(set([cn2.id, cn3.id]), set(rp_ids)) rp_ids = rp_obj._get_provider_ids_with_required_traits( self.ctx, ['CUSTOM_TRAIT_A', 'CUSTOM_TRAIT_B']) self.assertEqual(set([cn3.id]), set(rp_ids)) rp_ids = rp_obj._get_provider_ids_with_required_traits( self.ctx, ['CUSTOM_TRAIT_C']) self.assertEqual([], rp_ids) cn2.set_traits(objects.TraitList(objects=[t_a])) cn3.set_traits(objects.TraitList(objects=[t_b])) agg_id = uuidsentinel.agg_a cn2.set_aggregates([agg_id]) cn3.set_aggregates([agg_id]) rp_ids = rp_obj._get_provider_ids_with_required_traits( self.ctx, ['CUSTOM_TRAIT_A', 'CUSTOM_TRAIT_B'], {2: [cn3.id]}) self.assertEqual([cn2.id], rp_ids)

commit_message:
placement: add traits support to get resource_providers with shared

This patch adds new parameter 'traits' to the _get_all_with_shared()
function. Also filter the results by the return of
'_get_provider_ids_with_required_traits'.

Change-Id: I089d1cec405ebe4a3735ded44706b6b3cff3463f
Partial-implement-blueprint add-trait-support-in-allocation-candidates

added_lines: def test_get_all_with_shared_and_traits(self): # The aggregate that will be associated to everything... agg_uuid = uuidsentinel.agg # Create the two compute node providers cn1_uuid = uuidsentinel.cn1 cn1 = objects.ResourceProvider( self.context, name='cn1', uuid=cn1_uuid, ) cn1.create() cn2_uuid = uuidsentinel.cn2 cn2 = objects.ResourceProvider( self.context, name='cn2', uuid=cn2_uuid, ) cn2.create() # Populate the two compute node providers with inventory, sans DISK_GB for cn in (cn1, cn2): vcpu = objects.Inventory( resource_provider=cn, resource_class=fields.ResourceClass.VCPU, total=24, reserved=0, min_unit=1, max_unit=24, step_size=1, allocation_ratio=16.0, ) memory_mb = objects.Inventory( resource_provider=cn, resource_class=fields.ResourceClass.MEMORY_MB, total=1024, reserved=0, min_unit=64, max_unit=1024, step_size=1, allocation_ratio=1.5, ) inv_list = objects.InventoryList(objects=[vcpu, memory_mb]) cn.set_inventory(inv_list) # Create the shared storage pool ss_uuid = uuidsentinel.ss ss = objects.ResourceProvider( self.context, name='shared storage', uuid=ss_uuid, ) ss.create() # Give the shared storage pool some inventory of DISK_GB disk_gb = objects.Inventory( resource_provider=ss, resource_class=fields.ResourceClass.DISK_GB, total=2000, reserved=0, min_unit=10, max_unit=100, step_size=1, allocation_ratio=1.0, ) inv_list = objects.InventoryList(objects=[disk_gb]) ss.set_inventory(inv_list) # Mark the shared storage pool as having inventory shared among any # provider associated via aggregate t = objects.Trait( self.context, name="MISC_SHARES_VIA_AGGREGATE", ) # TODO(jaypipes): Once MISC_SHARES_VIA_AGGREGATE is a standard # os-traits trait, we won't need to create() here. Instead, we will # just do: # t = objects.Trait.get_by_name( # self.context, # "MISC_SHARES_VIA_AGGREGATE", # ) t.create() ss.set_traits(objects.TraitList(objects=[t])) # Now associate the shared storage pool and both compute nodes with the # same aggregate cn1.set_aggregates([agg_uuid]) cn2.set_aggregates([agg_uuid]) ss.set_aggregates([agg_uuid]) t_custom_a = objects.Trait(self.context, name='CUSTOM_A') t_custom_a.create() t_custom_b = objects.Trait(self.context, name='CUSTOM_B') t_custom_b.create() cn1.set_traits(objects.TraitList(objects=[t_custom_a, t_custom_b])) cn2.set_traits(objects.TraitList(objects=[t_custom_a])) resources = self._requested_resources() # Before we associate the compute nodes and shared storage provider # with the same aggregate, verify that no resource providers are found # that meet the requested set of resource amounts got_rps = rp_obj._get_all_with_shared( self.context, resources, ['CUSTOM_A', 'CUSTOM_B'] ) got_ids = [rp.id for rp in got_rps] self.assertEqual([cn1.id], got_ids) got_rps = rp_obj._get_all_with_shared( self.context, resources, ['CUSTOM_A'] ) got_ids = [rp.id for rp in got_rps] self.assertEqual([cn1.id, cn2.id], got_ids) t_ssd = objects.Trait(self.context, name='CUSTOM_STORAGE_SSD') t_ssd.create() ss.set_traits(objects.TraitList(objects=[t, t_ssd])) got_rps = rp_obj._get_all_with_shared( self.context, resources, ['CUSTOM_STORAGE_SSD'] ) got_ids = [rp.id for rp in got_rps] self.assertEqual([cn1.id, cn2.id], got_ids)

commit_message:
consume load_class_by_alias_or_classname from neutron-lib

neutron-lib now contains the load_class_by_alias_or_classname function.
This patch removes the function from neutron and uses it from lib.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: I47ef642fcb3c8ded5eb7ed0a637033c7bcb3632b

commit_message:
use default subnetpool api def from lib

The default subnetpools extension's API definition was added to
neutron-lib with Ib841f3727e758c0c19c9a4a0acd221ecb4081313. This patch
consumes the API definition from lib.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: I48a1a637e9c45499916ade61cc9f38de3278e67e

commit_message:
Implement policy in code (1)

This commit will prepare for implementing policies in code[1].

Once we completed moving all of policies into code base,
we can also change default policy rules via policy.yaml
instead of policy.json and generate policy.yaml by command:
$ tox -e genpolicy

[1]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html

Change-Id: I587ee663eff9632ec355cef8152c13e1ebfffeb5
Co-authored-By: Hieu LE <hieulq@vn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
Bypass web server during service setup

When connecting directly to a keystone host during service setup, use
the UWSGI ports instead of going through the web server to avoid any
potential errors with differing URI protocols or SSL certs not including
the hostnames of individual hosts.

Change-Id: Ie5b33f9d0210a23badb63cab72c481b027790be3
Closes-Bug: 1699191

commit_message:
Added nat_source flag for networks.

In some more complex clouds there can not only be more than one valid network
on a server that NAT can attach to, there can also be more than one valid
network from which to get a NAT address. Allow flagging a network so that it
can be found.

Change-Id: I3d8dd6d734a1013d2d4a43e11c3538c3a345820b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-client-config refs/changes/51/513751/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: `nat_source` is a boolean field that indicates which network floating ips should be requested from. It defaults to false. Normally this can be inferred by looking for a network that is attached to a route. But it's possible to have more than one network that satisfies that condition, so the user might want to tell programs which one to pick. There can be only one `nat_source` per cloud.

commit_message:
Add shade-tox-tips jobs

Breaking shade with changes to os-client-config is bad. Add shade's
unittest jobs that are configured to work against os-client-config
master.

Also move the legacy osc dsvm job here so we can remove it from
project-config.

Change-Id: Ie3e9a4deca1d74b94e810e87e130706fe15fe2c9
Depends-On: I5b411be5c5aa43535fa89a51d6099aadd7a8ea60

commit_message:
move git configuration for release jobs to ansible tasks

Instead of scripting the git configuration, use tasks in pre playbooks
for the jobs. We use different settings for tag-releases and
propose-constraint-updates.

Change-Id: Id3713d89a8b2af821de41a146954be551337cf75
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Warn when configuring dedicated database connection for placement API

The options supporting this are discussed in change
39fb302fd9c8fc57d3e4bea1c60a02ad5067163f, which has since been reverted.
It may be implemented in the future, but currently has no effect.

Change-Id: I63db5b9762d5bdaf6583a4b68c6407f6fbcf33c6
(cherry picked from commit a36977475a293db8cdc9aabd4fb10fd315aff6f6)

commit_message:
Allow setting log files for apache vhost

This allows the setting of the error and access file logs, as well as
the access log format. This was done in a similar fashion as one can
configure these ones in the keystone wsgi manifest.

commit_message:
Synchronize ironic and ironicclients list of boot devices

Ensure list of boot devices specified in ironic matches whats
specified in ironicclient. Specifically in this case adding
'wanboot'.

Change-Id: Icd427fc02296cca94ebe722d4cacecb3a902d4c2
Closes-Bug: #1724974
Signed-off-by: Matt Keenan <matt.keenan@gmail.com>

added_lines: BOOT_DEVICES = ['pxe', 'disk', 'cdrom', 'bios', 'safe', 'wanboot']

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-21 16:05:17.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/c9e109f1359e2310fab1190d164a28822fc09208', 'message': "Disable nested virt in base devstack job

Change-Id: Ie71663c3144908ddd134fa5a5b1b2d265a60edcf

commit_message:
Disable nested virt in base devstack job

We were doing this in devstack-gate. The gate can't handle nested virt.

Change-Id: Ie71663c3144908ddd134fa5a5b1b2d265a60edcf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/48/513948/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Gate jobs can't deal with nested virt. Disable it. LIBVIRT_TYPE: qemu

commit_message:
Automate doc creation as part of init-series

With dynamically generated series index headers, we can now automate the
creation of a new release series' documentation pages.

Change-Id: I9adf48aaf8d78821a73c74e7e5372d7269136270

commit_message:
Add release highlights to deliverables

This adds the ability to provide release highlights in the deliverable
yaml file that get extracted and compiled into a highlights page for
each release.

Change-Id: I1d72f4608f0dd2b11894f918d89be1ad0ad9c8fd

We check out our branches with git directly and do not use

'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Fix branch check for proposal script"

We check out our branches with git directly and do not use
prepolated content. Thus, we do have remote branches here and need this.

This reverts commit 4eeb97c278b70445d0d6bb0a1779282d5aeffd01.

Change-Id: I0fece091a9bdf305d8370899a7e9aa7a21ae05b4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/44/513944/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # check whether the project has this branch or a suitable fallback if git branch -a | grep -q "^ remotes/origin/$ZUUL_REFNAME$" ; then
deleted_lines: # check whether the project has this branch if git branch | grep -q "^ $ZUUL_REFNAME$" ; then

commit_message:
Fix flake8

fix a "bug" in that the flake8 configuration in tox.ini was exclusively
selecting H231 as the only error it would report, so it was missing the
errors in the python modules (such as submit_log_processor_jobs). Due to
this being the case for a long time (since 2004) limit the more thorough
linting to the roles/ and playbooks/ directories where we'll be adding
ansible plugins/modules/etc. Also, lint in jenkins/script and nodepool.

Fix problems found.

We can lint everything with pep8 once the zuul v2 scripts are removed,
not worth patching them right now.

Change-Id: I479f010643cf3b67c183d763510f07a33400d38b
Co-Authored-By: Jesse Keating <omgjlk@us.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Create infra-zuul-jobs-linters job

A shared job we can run on project-config, openstack-zuul-jobs and
zuul-jobs to better lint our ansible playbook and roles.

Start with non-voting so we can iterate on it.

Change-Id: Ibb48368bb8addb25f30cebdd3245fd28675b738b
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/58/513958/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - job: name: infra-zuul-jobs-linters parent: tox description: | This job runs against openstack-zuul-jobs project-config and zuul-jobs so we can properly lint our ansible playbooks / roles required-projects: - openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs - openstack-infra/project-config - openstack-infra/zuul-jobs vars: tox_envlist: linters tox_environment: ANSIBLE_ROLES_PATH: ~/src/git.openstack.org/openstack-infra/zuul-jobs/roles:~/src/git.openstack.org/openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs/roles:~/src/git.openstack.org/openstack-infra/project-config/roles

commit_message:
Allow creating security rules without protocol

In order to create a rule for any protocol, the client
must not specify the protocol in the API call. This
is currently impossible because protocol defaults to TCP.

In order not to change the default behavior, a "new" protocol
name is added: "any", which makes this CLI skip sending the
protocol field altogether.

Change-Id: I58853d3745f3631007e5e9780c0c5c2526b730a3
Closes-Bug: 1712242

commit_message:
Initial OSA zuul v3 role jobs

This patch implements an initial set of jobs intended to match
the current job execution method. It does not intend to improve
how the jobs are executed - only to replicate what is currently
in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs and provide the platform
to iterate on.

commit_message:
Remove unneeded msgfmt test

The infra scripts run msgfmt since some time, no need to run it here as
well.

This fixes the pep8 failure in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/493290/
since that change removes the remaining po files and now the find fails
since there is no po file anymore.

Change-Id: I6a8b99a9d63e421f4a6eae6f0aab6d0955f7916b

commit_message:
Grafana: fix zuul pipeline gauges

This is the correct key under zuulv3.  A bug (fix in progress) still
had some reports occasionally being emitted under the old key (on
reconfiguration events).

Change-Id: I5e2e65b1c9831f2f60e7916e26a3792d86ec25ae

commit_message:
Update upgrade role for Queens from P

This changes the a-r-r with the proper version, and fixes
the repo path for role upgrades:

The role will, during test-upgrade-pre, have its current branch
checked out, and will deploy the current branch infrastructure,
including the generation of the constraints.

Then, the installation of previous branch of the role will use
the constraints for its previous version, but will have no
constraints for it, and fail.

We need to generate the constraints for the previous version too.
This should do it.

This patch also implements an initial set of jobs intended to
match the current job execution method. It does not intend to
improve how the jobs are executed - only to replicate what is
currently in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs and provide
the platform to iterate on.

Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>
Depends-On: I0391ec310c4eede436011a48490e3c524c8ddf4d
Change-Id: Ib35253ed9020ed27280329891509292b5b463d6c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova refs/changes/79/496679/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: version: stable/pike

commit_message:
Fix branch check for proposal script

We no longer have remote branches in our git clones, just check for the
proper local branch to exist.

Change-Id: I43b9f10c3b41c6cb3eb215d6d4552f2205e76012

deleted_lines: # check whether the project has this branch or a suitable fallback if git branch -a | grep -q "^ remotes/origin/$ZUUL_REFNAME$" ; then

commit_message:
Update make_rest_client to work with version discovery

Using make_rest_client on clouds that put unversioned endpoints in the
catalog results in incorrectly set up adapters.

Add the plumbing to get_session_client to pass version args to
keystoneauth. Then use that from make_rest_client.

Change-Id: I69ad746f672ef0b12680e9db3c7b0c691c9f87e4

commit_message:
Add unittest tips jobs

Changes to keystoneauth and os-client-config are deeply important to
shade. Add a job that runs shade's unittests against their master
branches.

Change-Id: I5b411be5c5aa43535fa89a51d6099aadd7a8ea60
Depends-On: Ifa5cc3e335b9e9ad52c4c5c9ab71aaea70d4c9aa
Depends-On: I387f01557afc36fd621197e2a97500ef44d7aace

commit_message:
Initial OSA zuul v3 role jobs

This patch implements an initial set of jobs intended to match
the current job execution method. It does not intend to improve
how the jobs are executed - only to replicate what is currently
in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs and provide the platform
to iterate on.

Change-Id: Ib1d06f9862503faa7178fd927287b5ebfc05c900

commit_message:
conf: Remove deprecated 'null_kernel' opt

This flag was deprecated in a previous cycle. The flag and any uses of
it can now be removed.

Change-Id: Ie26f34b4f435eeb378b88f0c48f844b511696eb9

commit_message:
Set success-url on coverage jobs to cover/

We fetch the coverage reports into the cover directory on logs. The
coverage report is the main thing you want to look at from a coverage
job. Set the url to that.

Change-Id: I387f01557afc36fd621197e2a97500ef44d7aace

commit_message:
Fix neutron-lbaas-dashboard to use -horizon jobs

The neutron-lbaas-dashboard project needs to use the -horizon versions
of the openstack-python-jobs, publish-openstack-sphinx-docs, and
publish-to-pypi templates.

Change-Id: I04572a53e88aa10406f306ddbcb6c32449c4902d

commit_message:
Remove networking-ovn legacy jobs

make openstack-tox-cover inherit from tox-cover

rather than from openstack-tox so that it will sync up the coverage
report detail to the log root of the executor.

commit_message:
Add network availability zone information for network agents

This patch adds the availability zone column for network agents on the system
information page, if either the router_availability_zone or the
network_availability_zone extension is enabled.

Change-Id: Id7509fab440383bff45cb8ce5bdc3f8eb62045f4
Closes-Bug: #1716638

commit_message:
Swap the order of interface and endpoint_type

The parameter we should desire is 'interface'. 'endpoint_type' is the
old name. List the non-compliant clients rather than the compliant
clients so that we can more easily track which ones we need to go work
on.

Change-Id: Iedcebc74e14abea49f3bcc087a1ff506520d7183

commit_message:
Propose release notes for Rally 0.10.0

Change-Id: Idd1a72f17756f275ba453959b35fadf6d650fe55
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/80/480680/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ============= Rally v0.10.0 ============= Overview -------- +------------------+-----------------------+ | Release date | **7/06/2017** | +------------------+-----------------------+ * Ability to use OpenStack deployments without admin credentials * Ability to use Rally without OpenStack (for any platform) * Better validation process of tasks * Ability to set description for workloads * `OSProfiler support <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/quick_start/tutorial/step_11_profiling_openstack_internals.html>`_ Details ------- Command Line Interface ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ * Introduce `rally task import <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/cli_reference.html#rally-task-import>`_ command for importing task results into database. * Extend tags feature of tasks. Now you can specify several tags for a single task while launching it via `--tag argument <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/cli_reference.html#task-start-tag>`_ and filter task in `list command <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/cli_reference.html#task-list-tag>`_. Deployments ~~~~~~~~~~~ * From the beginning, Rally project required an admin credentials to be set up in Rally deployment, even when a feature about using existing users was introduced. Finally, we finished a big refactor and admin credential become optional. If a set of plugins for particular workload doesn't require admin user, you can launch it at deployment without setting it. The information about the requirements of plugins you can find at `Plugins Reference page <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html>`_ (see ``Requires platform(s):`` section at the bottom of each plugin). * Originally, Rally project was designed to check performance of OpenStack and we succeeded in building awesome tool. We do not plan stop and just want to inform about our future plans to expand a number of supported platforms (the code base is ready and you can start writing your custom plugins for custom platforms/applications). Subscribe to out `GitHub organization <https://github.com/xrally>`_ to not miss new plugins. PS: we started testing Rally project via Rally to check that our performance doesn't degrade. Task component ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ * The atomic actions now supports child actions. They are not displayed in HTML report yet, but you can process them via JSON report ``rally task report --json``. * Generation of names for new resources takes care about particular workload id, so it helps to provide a better cleanup and prepare for new feature - disaster cleanup. * The support of descriptions for workloads is added. See our self job for as `an example <https://github.com/openstack/rally/blob/0.10.0/rally-jobs/self-rally.yaml>`_ Plugins ~~~~~~~ We started supporting discovering plugins by entry-points, so you can easily deliver your custom plugins as a simple python package. To make you package after-discoverable, you need to specify the proper entry-point at your setup.cfg file: .. code-block:: rally_plugins = path=package_name **Deployment Engines**: Remove serverproviders & rarely used deployers Unfortunately, seems like nobody is using deployers for deploying their clouds and mostly people would like just to execute their code. It is a start of a bit refactoring. 1) Remove server provides 2) Remove engines that uses server providers **OpenStack clients**: * Deprecate EC2 client. It wasn't used in any of plugins and doesn't support keystone v3 **Scenarios**: * *NEW!!* - `CinderQos.create_and_get_qos <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#cinderqos-create-and-get-qos-scenario>`_ - `CinderQos.create_and_list_qos <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#cinderqos-create-and-list-qos-scenario>`_ - `CinderQos.create_and_set_qos <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#cinderqos-create-and-set-qos-scenario>`_ - `CinderVolumeTypes.create_and_get_volume_type <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#cindervolumetypes-create-and-get-volume-type-scenario>`_ - `CinderVolumeTypes.create_and_list_volume_types <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#cindervolumetypes-create-and-list-volume-types-scenario>`_ - `CinderVolumeTypes.create_and_update_encryption_type <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#cindervolumetypes-create-and-update-encryption-type-scenario>`_ - `CinderVolumeTypes.create_and_update_volume_type <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#cindervolumetypes-create-and-update-volume-type-scenario>`_ - `CinderVolumeTypes.create_get_and_delete_encryption_type <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#cindervolumetypes-create-get-and-delete-encryption-type-scenario>`_ - `CinderVolumeTypes.create_volume_type_add_and_list_type_access <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#cindervolumetypes-create-volume-type-add-and-list-type-access-scenario>`_ - `Dummy.openstack <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#dummy-openstack-scenario>`_ - `GlanceImages.create_and_get_image <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#glanceimages-create-and-get-image-scenario>`_ - `GlanceImages.create_and_update_image <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#glanceimages-create-and-update-image-scenario>`_ - `K8sPods.create_pods <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#k8spods-create-pods-scenario>`_ - `K8sPods.create_rcs <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#k8spods-create-rcs-scenario>`_ - `K8sPods.list_pods <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#k8spods-list-pods-scenario>`_ - `ManilaShares.create_and_extend_share <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#manilashares-create-and-extend-share-scenario>`_ - `ManilaShares.create_and_shrink_share <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#manilashares-create-and-shrink-share-scenario>`_ - `NeutronBGPVPN.create_and_delete_bgpvpns <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#neutronbgpvpn-create-and-delete-bgpvpns-scenario>`_ - `NeutronBGPVPN.create_and_list_bgpvpns <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#neutronbgpvpn-create-and-list-bgpvpns-scenario>`_ - `NeutronBGPVPN.create_and_update_bgpvpns <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#neutronbgpvpn-create-and-update-bgpvpns-scenario>`_ - `NeutronBGPVPN.create_bgpvpn_assoc_disassoc_networks <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#neutronbgpvpn-create-bgpvpn-assoc-disassoc-networks-scenario>`_ - `NeutronNetworks.create_and_show_routers <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#neutronnetworks-create-and-show-routers-scenario>`_ - `NeutronNetworks.create_and_show_subnets <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#neutronnetworks-create-and-show-subnets-scenario>`_ - `NeutronNetworks.set_and_clear_router_gateway <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#neutronnetworks-set-and-clear-router-gateway-scenario>`_ - `NeutronSecurityGroup.create_and_list_security_group_rules <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#neutronsecuritygroup-create-and-list-security-group-rules-scenario>`_ - `NeutronSecurityGroup.create_and_show_security_group <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#neutronsecuritygroup-create-and-show-security-group-scenario>`_ - `NeutronSecurityGroup.create_and_show_security_group_rule <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#neutronsecuritygroup-create-and-show-security-group-rule-scenario>`_ - `NovaServerGroups.create_and_get_server_group <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#novaservergroups-create-and-get-server-group-scenario>`_ - `NovaServers.boot_server_and_attach_interface <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#novaservers-boot-server-and-attach-interface-scenario>`_ - `NovaServers.boot_server_and_list_interfaces <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#novaservers-boot-server-and-list-interfaces-scenario>`_ * *UPDATED!!* - The new argument ``properties`` is added to scenario `IronicNodes.create_and_list_node <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#ironicnodes-create-and-list-node-scenario>`_ * *DELETED* Fuel and Nova-Network are not alive any more. So we removed those scenarios. If any of those scenarios a critical for you, please contact us. - `FuelEnvironments.create_and_delete_environment <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/0.9.0/plugins/plugin_reference.html#fuelenvironments-create-and-delete-environment-scenario>`_ - `FuelEnvironments.create_and_list_environments <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/0.9.0/plugins/plugin_reference.html#fuelenvironments-create-and-list-environments-scenario>`_ - `FuelNodes.add_and_remove_node <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/0.9.0/plugins/plugin_reference.html#fuelnodes-add-and-remove-node-scenario>`_ - `NovaFloatingIpsBulk.create_and_delete_floating_ips_bulk <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/0.9.0/plugins/plugin_reference.html#novafloatingipsbulk-create-and-delete-floating-ips-bulk-scenario>`_ - `NovaFloatingIpsBulk.create_and_list_floating_ips_bulk <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/0.9.0/plugins/plugin_reference.html#novafloatingipsbulk-create-and-list-floating-ips-bulk-scenario>`_ - `NovaNetworks.create_and_delete_network <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/0.9.0/plugins/plugin_reference.html#novanetworks-create-and-delete-network-scenario>`_ - `NovaNetworks.create_and_list_networks <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/0.9.0/plugins/plugin_reference.html#novanetworks-create-and-list-networks-scenario>`_ - `NovaSecGroup.boot_and_delete_server_with_secgroups <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/0.9.0/plugins/plugin_reference.html#novasecgroup-boot-and-delete-server-with-secgroups-scenario>`_ - `NovaSecGroup.boot_server_and_add_secgroups <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/0.9.0/plugins/plugin_reference.html#novasecgroup-boot-server-and-add-secgroups-scenario>`_ - `NovaSecGroup.create_and_delete_secgroups <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/0.9.0/plugins/plugin_reference.html#novasecgroup-create-and-delete-secgroups-scenario>`_ - `NovaSecGroup.create_and_list_secgroups <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/0.9.0/plugins/plugin_reference.html#novasecgroup-create-and-list-secgroups-scenario>`_ - `NovaSecGroup.create_and_update_secgroups <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/0.9.0/plugins/plugin_reference.html#novasecgroup-create-and-update-secgroups-scenario>`_ **Validators**: The validators refactoring a long-term task which was a blocker for abandoning alignment to only OpenStack platform and requirements of setting admin credentials. In this release, we made a great progress and fixed a lot of issues and blockers which made possible to refactor validators. Now validation step is equal for all types of plugins (Scenario, SLA, Context, Hooks, Runners, etc). The old way to add validator for scenario is deprecated. The new unified way looks like: .. code-block:: python import time from rally.common import validation from rally.task import scenario @validation.add("number", param_name="timeout", minval=0) @scenario.configure(name="Foo.bar") class FooScenario(scenario.Scenario): def run(self, timeout): time.sleep() The old validators from ``rally.task.validators`` module is deprecated too, see equivalents which can be used with ``add`` decorator: - required_openstack --> `required_platform <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#required-platform-validator>`_ with setting platform argument to "openstack" - external_network_exists ->`external_network_exists <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#external-network-exists-validator>`_ - file_exists ->`file_exists <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#file-exists-validator>`_ - image_exists ->`image_exists <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#image-exists-validator>`_ - image_valid_on_flavor ->`image_valid_on_flavor <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#image-valid-on-flavor-validator>`_ - number ->`number <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#number-validator>`_ - required_api_versions ->`required_api_versions <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#required-api-versions-validator>`_ - required_cinder_services ->`required_cinder_services <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#required-cinder-services-validator>`_ - required_clients ->`required_clients <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#required-clients-validator>`_ - required_contexts ->`required_contexts <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#required-contexts-validator>`_ - required_neutron_extensions ->`required_neutron_extensions <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#required-neutron-extensions-validator>`_ - required_param_or_context ->`required_param_or_context <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#required-param-or-context-validator>`_ - required_services ->`required_services <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#required-services-validator>`_ - restricted_parameters ->`restricted_parameters <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#restricted-parameters-validator>`_ - validate_heat_template ->`validate_heat_template <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#validate-heat-template-validator>`_ - volume_type_exists ->`volume_type_exists <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#volume-type-exists-validator>`_ - network_exists was removed, since we do not find any customers for it. Please contact us if it was useful for you. All other validators will move soon. Fixed bugs ~~~~~~~~~~ * [plugins] JSON schema of `servers <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#servers-context>`_ context allows to transmit a list of nics in two formats. First one is a format that novaclient expects to see (each network should be represented like ``{"nic-id": "the id of the network"}``). The second one is more user-friendly - just list of strings (each network should be represented just by id of the network). Unfortunately, the second case was not covered by our code base. Also, the first described format works in limited cases due to bad serialization. `Launchpad bug-report #1695245 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/rally/+bug/1695245>`_ * [deployment] ~/rally/.openrc not working for keystone v3 `Launchpad bug-report #1683820 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/rally/+bug/1683820>`_ * [plugins] Failed to list volumes in case of missed name in the object. * [backported into 0.9.1][deployment] Credentials is not updated as soon as deployment is recreated. Need to call recreate request twice. `Launchpad bug-report #1675271 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/rally/+bug/1675271>`_ * [backported into 0.9.1][plugins] Scenario `IronicNodes.create_and_list_node <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#ironicnodes-create-and-list-node-scenario>`_ had a wrong check that list of all nodes contains newly created one. * [backported into 0.9.1][task][cleanup] Do not remove quotas in case of existing users * [backported into 0.9.1][task][cleanup] Various traces of neutron resources * [backported into 0.9.1][core] Keystone v3, authentication error for Rally users if the value of project_domain_name of admin user isn't equal "default" `Launchpad bug-report #1680837 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/rally/+bug/1680837>`_ * [backported into 0.9.1][task] Scenario `NovaHosts.list_and_get_hosts <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/plugin_reference.html#novahosts-list-and-get-hosts-scenario>`_ obtains hostname for all hosts. But it fails in some environments if host is not compute. `Launchpad bug-report #1675254 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/rally/+bug/1675254>`_ * [backported into 0.9.1][verification] Rally fails to run on systems on which python-virtualenv is not installed `Launchpad bug-report #1678047 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/rally/+bug/1678047>`_ * [backported into 0.9.1][verification] CLI `rally verify rerun <https://rally.readthedocs.io/en/0.9.1/verification/cli_reference.html#rally-verify-rerun>`_ fails with TypeError due to wrong integration with Rally API. Thanks ~~~~~~ 2 Everybody!

commit_message:
mk_build_dir: fix and refactor

The current mk_build_dir is buggy: only the result of the creation of
TMP_IMAGE_DIR is checked.

The current implementation of mk_build_dir uses some code
duplications.

This patch fixes both issues.

Change-Id: I96faf432ccd40754af138ace417bf6781c973431
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/44/510344/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Create temporary directory for use as build or image dir. # $1 use_tmpfs: should a tmpfs be used (=0) or not (=1) # $2 base_name: base name of the temporary directory to be created. function mk_tmp_dir() { local use_tmpfs="$1" local base_name="$2" local tmp_dir=$(mktemp -t -d --tmpdir=${TMP_DIR:-/tmp} ${base_name}.XXXXXXXX) if [ "${use_tmpfs}" -eq 0 ] ; then sudo mount -t tmpfs tmpfs ${tmp_dir} sudo chown $(id -u):$(id -g) ${tmp_dir} echo ${tmp_dir} } function mk_build_dir () { tmpfs_check local use_tmpfs=$? TMP_BUILD_DIR=$(mk_tmp_dir ${use_tmpfs} dib_build) TMP_IMAGE_DIR=$(mk_tmp_dir ${use_tmpfs} dib_image) export TMP_BUILD_DIR export TMP_HOOKS_PATH=${TMP_BUILD_DIR}/hooks echo "Building in ${TMP_BUILD_DIR}"
deleted_lines: function mk_build_dir () { TMP_BUILD_DIR=$(mktemp -t -d --tmpdir=${TMP_DIR:-/tmp} dib_build.XXXXXXXX) TMP_IMAGE_DIR=$(mktemp -t -d --tmpdir=${TMP_DIR:-/tmp} dib_image.XXXXXXXX) export TMP_BUILD_DIR if tmpfs_check ; then sudo mount -t tmpfs tmpfs $TMP_BUILD_DIR sudo mount -t tmpfs tmpfs $TMP_IMAGE_DIR sudo chown $(id -u):$(id -g) $TMP_BUILD_DIR $TMP_IMAGE_DIR echo Building in $TMP_BUILD_DIR export OUT_IMAGE_PATH=$TMP_IMAGE_PATH export TMP_HOOKS_PATH=$TMP_BUILD_DIR/hooks

subject: Adds 'sata' as a valid disk bus for qemu and kvm hypervisors
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-25 17:37:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e492041619016ab2b73a505fa7520f4668e6f36c', 'message': "Adds 'sata' as a valid disk bus for qemu and kvm hypervisors

Change-Id: Ie32ff7acf31d80d4fc1adbeadaaf30a886d10e49
Closes-Bug: #1686136
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-07-07 19:12:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/00edff767b990a3dcb2e2c0091dc0f8f3af6b508', 'message': "Adds 'sata' as a valid disk bus for qemu and kvm hypervisors

Reasoning:
- Setting custom properties on glance images allows us to select the type of disk bus e.g. VIRTIO/IDE/SCSI.
Although SATA disk bus works perfectly for qemu/kvm, it is not allowed due to a check in virt/libvirt/blockinfo.py : is_disk_bus_valid_for_virt
- some Linux (custom) images require use of SATA bus rather than any other that seems to be allowed.

Change-Id: Ie32ff7acf31d80d4fc1adbeadaaf30a886d10e49
Closes-Bug: #1686136
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-07-07 19:14:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d411626d292e4cf69d0c6d236c06f057b3ffea93', 'message': "Adds 'sata' as a valid disk bus for qemu and kvm hypervisors

Reasoning:
- Setting custom properties on glance images allows us to select the
type of disk bus e.g. VIRTIO/IDE/SCSI.

due to a check in virt/libvirt/blockinfo.py : is_disk_bus_valid_for_virt

commit_message:
Adds 'sata' as a valid disk bus for qemu and kvm hypervisors

Reasoning:
- Setting custom properties on glance images allows us to select the
type of disk bus e.g. VIRTIO/IDE/SCSI.
Although SATA disk bus works perfectly for qemu/kvm, it is not allowed
due to a check in virt/libvirt/blockinfo.py : is_disk_bus_valid_for_virt
- some Linux (custom) images require use of SATA bus rather than any
other that seems to be allowed.

Change-Id: Ie32ff7acf31d80d4fc1adbeadaaf30a886d10e49
Closes-Bug: #1686136

commit_message:
Remove unecessary playbook

We should be able to set the tox work dir in the job definition.

Also, updates the files matcher so changes to the jobs cause them
to run.

Change-Id: I519a5257bb3806169ee78dee9ac6ae92d282a889

commit_message:
Ignore wheels that exist natively whl upstream

The build times for the usefulness of this patch speaks for itself. The
requirements gate now takes less than 10m, down from over 14m on
average.

Change-Id: I1eb48762a57bb024937c5a4ec4aa3b7c5ce2348c

commit_message:
Update stestr to 1.1.0

* stestr-1.1.0 contains lots of fixes which are discovered during
  migrating test runner from testr to stestr. It would be good to
  update to switch to 1.1.0

* https://github.com/mtreinish/stestr/releases/tag/1.1.0

Change-Id: I834aa3e7c028d7d29566458e16e8fc9d8dd72c29

Convert SB API to use ovsdbapp

Functional tests were written before SB methods were modified and
then run against the modifications

subject: Revise cluster/node check action records design
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-20 02:08:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/senlin/commit/a561286baa384c33cef5e53a5769ea6cb89f8aa6', 'message': 'Create service record before start health manager

Because we suppose current service record has been created
when we start health manager, we need change the order about them.
This patch changes the order of this.

Closes-Bug: #1666092
Change-Id: Ia356a6a7e5f3afca5a10b6ca5961c9119012834c
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-20 11:04:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/senlin/commit/f038e044e78f2f2adbe2db7cb1482863b4ee6d0d', 'message': 'Revise cluster/node check action records design

This patch revises cluster/node check action records design, the prurpose
is to avoid creating too many action records when do cluster/node checking
periodically.
And we will not delete check action records from manual operation.

commit_message:
Revise cluster/node check action records design

This patch revises cluster/node check action records design, the purpose
is to avoid creating too many action records when we do cluster/node
checking periodically.
And we will not delete check action records which are  from manual operation.

Implements: blueprint improve-action-event

Change-Id: Ia356a6a7e5f3afca5a10b6ca5961c9119012834c

commit_message:
Trivial: fix spelling of allocation_request

Reviews of other patches in this series raised the criticism that the
term 'allocation request' was being used, when the proper name for it
should be 'allocation_request'. I've broken these simple corrections
into a separate patch so as not to clutter up the other patches.

Blueprint: return-alternate-hosts

Change-Id: Idd2b9e3b0000fa8eeb2e0e9c3337b1d99b13ada7

commit_message:
Fixes toggle behavior in Network Topology graphs

Changes the buttons (Toggle Labels and Toggle Network Collapse)
 in the network topology graph view into bootstrap styled checkboxes
(the buttons should now operate as on/off) and modifies the relevant
js code to prevent random un-toggeling on data loading. Additionally,
the states for each button should now be respected on page refresh.

Change-Id: I16c00786a2c7cd37a38ebecc9494861232d2f473
Closes-Bug: 1672723

commit_message:
Fix puppet-openstack_spec_helper for Zuulv3

With Zuulv3, the value of ZUUL_REF is always empty as well as
the value of ZUUL_URL which can shift arguments by one and
cause an issue.

Depends-On: Idd846c569a6e067125e130f189be9ae8ffba1646
Change-Id: I055677ea7664ed488ee1f05193b7fdb7dc5bcb3a
(cherry picked from commit 1374d1055e61e12be9374e197fd7a00cf3a9c2f5)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack_spec_helper refs/changes/67/509567/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: zuul_ref = ENV['ZUUL_REF'] zuul_url = ENV['ZUUL_URL'] zuul_clone_cmd += ['--zuul-ref', "#{zuul_ref}"] zuul_clone_cmd += ['--zuul-url', "#{zuul_url}"] script += ["ZUUL_REF=#{zuul_ref}"] script += ["ZUUL_URL=#{zuul_url}"]

commit_message:
Implement policy in code (6)

Like oslo.config, with oslo.policy, we can define all of
default rules in code base and only change some rules
via policy file. Another thing that we should use yaml
format instead of json format[1].

This commit will move all default policies to code for:
- actions
- events
- services
- webhooks

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html

Change-Id: I0919eb5dc84c0e134b4918f477923b53dc9fbbbb
Co-authored-By: Hieu LE <hieulq@vn.fujitsu.com>

Added type checks for ha device owners

Added owner check types to is_interface function calls
used by templates to decide if the 'delete interface'
button should be displayed or not.

commit_message:
Correct the subnets quota check in admin networks panel

Currently when checking the subnets quota in admin networks table,
the current tenant subnets quota is checked, while the subnet is
created, using the tenant of the selected network[1], this doesn't
look the same. Similarly, in the network details subnets table,
the creation of subnets actions lacks quota checking.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/networks/subnets/workflows.py#L75

Change-Id: Ifb88b97168fc4f500e4bb15658f96363ddc7651f
Closes-Bug:#1719606

commit_message:
Accept 0 for --min-disk and --min-ram

The current openstackclient implementation cannot accept 0
for --min-disk and --min-ram with the "openstack image set" command.
If theses options get set to 0, the option parser in openstackclient
wrongly interprets 0 as no option value. The 0 is valid for these
options if administrators want to make it the default(no minimum
requirements).

This patch fix the parser so that it avoids only 'None'.

commit_message:
Add deployment name and uuid to ElasticExporter

Without this information it's hard to group by deployment data
and it becomes super hard to use ElasticSearch via Kibana or Grafana

Change-Id: Ie9402238d55fccd2255812aa38b8f75915886159

commit_message:
Hide IPv6-addresses when assigning floating IP addresses

A floating IP can only be associated with an IPv4 address, so we should
not show IPv6 addresses in the list of ports when assigning floating IP
addresses.

Change-Id: I7b39a263445204a9efbc8fe113cc79146d9bee8c
Closes-Bug: #1703360
Closes-Bug: #1724393

commit_message:
Router lists display availability zone information

When 'availability_zone'-extension is enabled, we present the user with
a column showing the availability zones for which the router is
scheduled in.

Change-Id: I87f6bfcee1f129a77e6bf9efa973a79bfa2afe14
Partial-bug: #1716638

subject: Fix UnhashableKeyWarning when calling get_security_groups function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-23 13:51:10.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/networks/ports/views.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/ca6ef9ef78318e7a469df6c748f6236e4f4e711d', 'message': 'Fix UnhashableKeyWarning when calling get_security_groups function

Memoized caches function specifies use tuples as parameters because
lists are not hashable. When the get_security_groups function is called,
the list type parameter is passed in, this causing fail to use memoized
and the console appears UnhashableKeyWarning.

Change-Id: Idc1262c714c3a6a451753286d6b414a27f6cb2cc
Closes-Bug:#1712582
'}]
commit_message:
Fix UnhashableKeyWarning when calling get_security_groups function

Memoized caches function specifies use tuples as parameters because
lists are not hashable. When the get_security_groups function is called,
the list type parameter is passed in, this causing fail to use memoized
and the console appears UnhashableKeyWarning.

Change-Id: Idc1262c714c3a6a451753286d6b414a27f6cb2cc
Closes-Bug:#1712582
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/11/496711/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: port.security_groups = self.get_security_groups( tuple(port.security_groups))

commit_message:
Replace deprecated alias 'os' with 'os_primary'

Tempest has deprecated the alias 'os' and will use the alias 'os_primary'
instead. The alias 'os' was deprecated in Pike and planned to be removed
in Queen.

Let's use the stable alias 'os_primary' for primary credential. This will
help Tempest to remove the deprecated alias 'os'.

Change-Id: I39c33acb6dc33d245c8452d1587c09b31178d728

commit_message:
Avoid deleting parent backup failed caused by 404

Catch NotFound exception in for loop, to avoid dropping out
while deleting parent backup that has multiple children backups.

Change-Id: Idab9fc8d6c09b0b58015b0b9fdf99811d075191f
Closes-bug: #1718572

commit_message:
Add deliverables info

neutron-vpnaas-dashboard is now not a TC-governed project,
so we don't have an entry in openstack/releases, but deliverable files
in openstack/releases are useful for tracking releases and
we can leverage release tools like 'new-release' from the releases repo.

This commit adds deliverable files to the repo.

Change-Id: I3caeecff393d491637231738f06533082c816dd0

commit_message:
Load plugins during the API initialization

It is the first thing that you should do if you would like to use
rally.api programmatically and that's going to be hard to figure out
for new rally users

So let's just load them.

Use rally.api in osresources script

Change-Id: Ib842537e6732bb6f4ae4bf333594fc14bcfeaf53

Update tests to do not use deprecated test.services()

Function 'tempest.test.services()' has moved to
'tempest.common.utils.services()' in version 'Pike'.
This commit update tests accordingly.

commit_message:
update docs to use nova_metadata_host

nova_metadata_ip is deprecated in favor of nova_metadata_host. This
patch updates our docs to use the latter matching our intent on removing
the former.

NOTE: I faced the warning message of this option on Pike also.
It would be great to avoid it for Pike users based on the docs.

Change-Id: I6a8e76acc2f01541f92123e46987b0f2f0fbf1cd
Closes-Bug: #1669955
(cherry picked from commit e7c75d180ba050f76ac414f249b38b5b22c1b42a)

commit_message:
Add a Zuul v3 native cross-check job

Convert the existing legacy-cross-* jobs over to the
new cross-check-job.

Adds a small bump to upper-constraints in order to test
the success of this review.

Co-Authored-By: Dirk Mueller <dirk@dmllr.de>
Change-Id: Iba6a025e3a10185ad1d8217244b967713cace3f6

commit_message:
Initial OSA zuul v3 role jobs

This patch implements an initial set of jobs intended to match
the current job execution method. It does not intend to improve
how the jobs are executed - only to replicate what is currently
in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs and provide the platform
to iterate on.

Change-Id: Ie8b995b690e3e3b5da1f777584d8a76a374fc0a9

commit_message:
Add commonly used repositories to required projects

Zuul is able to more effectively clone the roles used in
role tests more reliably that using a standard git clone
because it has a cache implementation to do exactly that.

This implements the commonly used role repositories as
required-projects for the tests so that our playbook to
get the ansible-role-requirements deoesn't have to do
the cloning, it'll just do the right symlinking. It will
still fetch any missing repositories, so this list does
not have to be a *full* list - just enough to help reduce
the current failures due to git cloning problems.

Change-Id: I203dce5ea87feed7c4354039f035742c9c3a5f36
(cherry picked from commit 394c2d7bb38959fdecc70bf5d50dea99a11aa4e0)

commit_message:
Add openstack-ansible-linters test

Currently the linters test is in the project-config
repository, but those are meant to be used for standard
jobs which do not require any repository other than the
one given. Our lint tests use the 'openstack-ansible-tests'
repository, so we should rather use our own job definition.
